summary_markdown: This data presents a comparative analysis of observed versus predicted customer base size and loyalty metrics across various retail sectors in Australia and New Zealand. The structure is hierarchical, categorizing by retail type (Department stores, Supermarkets, Retail petrol, Bank credit cards, Phone calls) and then by specific companies within those sectors. For each company, metrics are provided for Penetration (%), Average purchase frequency, Share of requirements (%), and Sole buyers (%), with both observed and predicted values. Notably, the Bank credit card sector in NZ shows particularly high observed loyalty metrics, with NAB and BNZ exhibiting substantial Share of requirements and Sole buyers, while the Phone calls sector (Telecom) also demonstrates very high penetration and loyalty. An overall average across all sectors is also presented, indicating a general trend of predicted values being slightly lower than observed for penetration and purchase frequency, but higher for sole buyers.
